title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement andrewbruce.himni@gmail.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Working with Large Data
code: # Index of TOC URLs centene_toc_urls <- data.frame(   entity = c("Centene"),   sub_entity = c("Ambetter",                  "Fidelis",                  "QualChoice",                  "HealthNet",                  "MHN",                  "WellCare_NC"),   type = c("toc"),   origin = c("https://www.centene.com/content/dam/centene/Centene%20Corporate/json/DOCUMENT/2022-08-30_ambetter_index.json",                 "https://www.centene.com/content/dam/centene/Centene%20Corporate/json/DOCUMENT/2022-08-30_fidelis_index.json",                "https://www.centene.com/content/dam/centene/Centene%20Corporate/json/DOCUMENT/2022-08-30_qualchoice_index.json",                "https://www.centene.com/content/dam/centene/Centene%20Corporate/json/DOCUMENT/2022-08-30_healthnet_index.json",                "https://www.centene.com/content/dam/centene/Centene%20Corporate/json/DOCUMENT/2022-08-30_mhn_index.json",                "https://www.centene.com/content/dam/centene/Centene%20Corporate/json/DOCUMENT/2022-08-30_wellcarenc_index.json"))  # Sub-Index of QualChoice TOC URls centene_toc_qualchoice_subs <- data.frame(   entity = c("Centene"),   sub_entity = c("QualChoice"),   sub_index = c("Alf",                 "Arnold_Bevins",                 "Hot_Springs",                 "Dillards",                 "JV_Manufacturing",                 "Royal_Financial"),   type = c("toc"),   origin =   c("https://www.centene.com/content/dam/centene/Centene%20Corporate/json/DOCUMENT/2022-08-30_qualchoice_alf_index.json",                "https://www.centene.com/content/dam/centene/Centene%20Corporate/json/DOCUMENT/2022-08-30_qualchoice_arnold_and_blevins_index.json",                "https://www.centene.com/content/dam/centene/Centene%20Corporate/json/DOCUMENT/2022-08-30_qualchoice_city_of_hot_springs_index.json",                "https://www.centene.com/content/dam/centene/Centene%20Corporate/json/DOCUMENT/2022-08-30_qualchoice_dillards_index.json",                "https://www.centene.com/content/dam/centene/Centene%20Corporate/json/DOCUMENT/2022-08-30_qualchoice_jv_manufacturing_index.json",                "https://www.centene.com/content/dam/centene/Centene%20Corporate/json/DOCUMENT/2022-08-30_qualchoice_royal_financial_index.json"))   # Join the two data frames toc_url_centene <- dplyr::full_join(   centene_toc_urls,   centene_toc_qualchoice_subs,    by = c("entity",          "sub_entity",          "type",           "origin"),    copy = TRUE) |>    dplyr::relocate(sub_index,                    .after = "sub_entity")

title: Working with Large Data
code: toc_resp_centene <- toc_url_centene |>                      dplyr::select(origin) |>                     dplyr::distinct() |>                      tibble::deframe() |>                      purrr::map_dfr(defog_toc) #> Error in `map()`: #> ℹ In index: 1. #> Caused by error in `curl::curl_fetch_memory()`: #> ! error:0A000152:SSL routines::unsafe legacy renegotiation disabled  toc_resp_centene <- toc_resp_centene |>                      dplyr::rename(type = rate_type) |>                      dplyr::mutate(entity = dplyr::case_when(                     entity == "Centene Management Company LLC" ~ "Centene",                      TRUE ~ entity)) #> Error in dplyr::rename(toc_resp_centene, type = rate_type): object 'toc_resp_centene' not found #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'toc_resp_centene' not found

title: Working with Large Data
code: oon_urls_centene <- toc_resp_centene |>                      dplyr::filter(type == "out_of_network") |>                      dplyr::select(location) |>                      dplyr::distinct() |>                      tibble::deframe() #> Error in dplyr::filter(toc_resp_centene, type == "out_of_network"): object 'toc_resp_centene' not found  oon_resp_centene <- oon_urls_centene |>                      purrr::map_dfr(defog_oon) #> Error in vctrs_vec_compat(.x, .purrr_user_env): object 'oon_urls_centene' not found  oon_resp_centene <- oon_resp_centene |>    filter(!is.na(billing_code_type)) #> Error in filter(oon_resp_centene, !is.na(billing_code_type)): object 'oon_resp_centene' not found #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'oon_resp_centene' not found

title: Working with Large Data
code: inn_urls_centene <- toc_resp_centene |>                      dplyr::filter(type == "in_network") |>                      dplyr::select(location) |>                      dplyr::distinct() |>                      tibble::deframe() #> Error in dplyr::filter(toc_resp_centene, type == "in_network"): object 'toc_resp_centene' not found #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'inn_urls_centene' not found inn_resp_cent.2 <- inn_urls_centene[2] |>                     purrr::map_dfr(defog_inn) #> Error in vctrs_vec_compat(.x, .purrr_user_env): object 'inn_urls_centene' not found inn_resp_cent.2 #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'inn_resp_cent.2' not found

what: Creating a Relational Database with dm
title: Working with Large Data
text: can build relational database R {dm} package, using data frames R environment. data model complete, can deploy range database management systems (DBMS). First, need create dm object:  Next, need define primary keys:  Now, need link two tables foreign key:
code: dm_centene_no_keys <- dm::dm(toc_url_centene, toc_resp_centene) #> Error in `map()`: #> ℹ In index: 2. #> Caused by error in `.f()`: #> ! object 'toc_resp_centene' not found #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'dm_centene_no_keys' not found dm::dm_enum_pk_candidates(dm = dm_centene_no_keys, table = toc_url_centene) #> Error in is_dm(dm): object 'dm_centene_no_keys' not found dm_centene_only_pks <- dm_centene_no_keys |> dm::dm_add_pk(table = toc_url_centene, columns = origin) #> Error in is_dm(dm): object 'dm_centene_no_keys' not found #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'dm_centene_only_pks' not found dm::dm_enum_fk_candidates(dm = dm_centene_only_pks, table = toc_resp_centene, ref_table = toc_url_centene) #> Error in is_dm(dm): object 'dm_centene_only_pks' not found dm_centene_all_keys <- dm_centene_only_pks |> dm::dm_add_fk(table = toc_resp_centene, columns = origin, ref_table = toc_url_centene) #> Error in is_dm(dm): object 'dm_centene_only_pks' not found #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'dm_centene_all_keys' not found

previous_headings: Creating a Relational Database with dm
title: Working with Large Data
code: dm_centene_no_keys |> dm::dm_draw(rankdir = "TB", view_type = "all") #> Error in is_dm(dm): object 'dm_centene_no_keys' not found dm_centene_only_pks |> dm::dm_draw(rankdir = "TB", view_type = "all") #> Error in is_dm(dm): object 'dm_centene_only_pks' not found dm_centene_all_keys |> dm::dm_draw(rankdir = "LR", view_type = "all") #> Error in is_dm(dm): object 'dm_centene_all_keys' not found

title: Defogging Transparency in Coverage Files
text: Next ’ll download one --network (OON) files, also known “allowed amounts” files. results , can filter rate_type column out_of_network make sure remove duplicate URLs {dplyr}’s distinct() function:   Next, plug URL object defog_oon() function retrieve file:  , ’ve limited output first ten rows demonstration purposes, gives good idea OON file contains. Next, ’ll retrieve -network file.
code: centene_oon_CA <- centene_toc |>    dplyr::filter(rate_type == "out_of_network") |>    dplyr::select(location) |>    dplyr::distinct() |>    tibble::deframe() #> Error in dplyr::filter(centene_toc, rate_type == "out_of_network"): object 'centene_toc' not found #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'centene_oon_CA' not found centene_oon_CA_file <- defog_oon(centene_oon_CA) |>                         dplyr::slice_head(n = 10) #> Error in defog_oon(centene_oon_CA): object 'centene_oon_CA' not found #> Error in dplyr::select(centene_oon_CA_file, npi, billing_code, name, allowed_amount, : object 'centene_oon_CA_file' not found

title: Defogging Transparency in Coverage Files
text: workflow -network (INN) file much , though output different, thus need different function. time, filter rate_type column in_network, making sure remove duplicate URLs:   plug URL object defog_inn() function:   output shows first ten rows 141,580 total. , without doubt, embarassment riches us healthcare data analytics. However, absent data points enable us expand analysis even . NPPES NPI Registry API comes handy.
code: centene_inn_CA <- centene_toc |>    dplyr::filter(rate_type == "in_network") |>    dplyr::select(location) |>    dplyr::distinct() |>    tibble::deframe() #> Error in dplyr::filter(centene_toc, rate_type == "in_network"): object 'centene_toc' not found #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'centene_inn_CA' not found centene_inn_CA_file <- defog_inn(centene_inn_CA) |>                         dplyr::slice_head(n = 10) #> Error in defog_inn(centene_inn_CA): object 'centene_inn_CA' not found #> Error in dplyr::select(centene_inn_CA_file, npi, billing_code, billing_code_modifier, : object 'centene_inn_CA_file' not found

title: Defogging Transparency in Coverage Files
text: Using NPPES Registry Search, can retrieve data provider’s taxonomy, credentials, gender, NPI type, payer-specific identifiers, etc. First, need isolate distinct NPIs OON INN results . five distinct NPIs --network file:   10 distinct NPIs -network file:   Next, pipe {defogger}’s NPPES search function, defog_npi(), via {purrr}’s map_dfr():   gives us two responses NPPES API, can unpack defog_npi_wide() function:    can join two pairs data frames analysis:     joins give us data frames following 68 columns:   Please see Big Data: dm, arrow & duckdb vignette example much -depth analysis.
code: # OON file centene_oon_npi <- centene_oon_CA_file |>                     dplyr::distinct(npi) |>                     unlist(use.names = FALSE) #> Error in dplyr::distinct(centene_oon_CA_file, npi): object 'centene_oon_CA_file' not found #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'centene_oon_npi' not found # INN file centene_inn_npi <- centene_inn_CA_file |>                     dplyr::distinct(npi) |>                     unlist(use.names = FALSE) #> Error in dplyr::distinct(centene_inn_CA_file, npi): object 'centene_inn_CA_file' not found #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'centene_inn_npi' not found # OON file NPIs centene_oon_npi_resp <- centene_oon_npi |>                          purrr::map_dfr(defog_npi) #> Error in vctrs_vec_compat(.x, .purrr_user_env): object 'centene_oon_npi' not found #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'centene_oon_npi_resp' not found # INN file NPIs centene_inn_npi_resp <- centene_inn_npi |>                          purrr::map_dfr(defog_npi) #> Error in vctrs_vec_compat(.x, .purrr_user_env): object 'centene_inn_npi' not found #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'centene_inn_npi_resp' not found # OON file response centene_oon_npi_result <- centene_oon_npi_resp |>                            dplyr::group_split(search) |>                            purrr::map_dfr(defog_npi_wide) #> Error in dplyr::group_split(centene_oon_npi_resp, search): object 'centene_oon_npi_resp' not found #> Error in dplyr::select(centene_oon_npi_result, npi, prov_type, organization_name, : object 'centene_oon_npi_result' not found # INN file response centene_inn_npi_result <- centene_inn_npi_resp |>                            dplyr::group_split(search) |>                            purrr::map_dfr(defog_npi_wide) #> Error in dplyr::group_split(centene_inn_npi_resp, search): object 'centene_inn_npi_resp' not found #> Error in dplyr::select(centene_inn_npi_result, npi, prov_type, last_name, : object 'centene_inn_npi_result' not found # OON join centene_oon_npi_join <- dplyr::full_join(centene_oon_CA_file,                                           centene_oon_npi_result,                                           by = "npi") #> Error in dplyr::full_join(centene_oon_CA_file, centene_oon_npi_result, : object 'centene_oon_CA_file' not found #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'centene_oon_npi_join' not found # INN join centene_inn_npi_join <- dplyr::full_join(centene_inn_CA_file,                                           centene_inn_npi_result,                                           by = "npi") #> Error in dplyr::full_join(centene_inn_CA_file, centene_inn_npi_result, : object 'centene_inn_CA_file' not found #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'centene_inn_npi_join' not found names(centene_oon_npi_join) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'centene_oon_npi_join' not found

title: Transparency in Coverage Guide
text: October 29, 2020, HHS Departments Labor Treasury finalized Transparency Coverage (TiC) Final Rule (CMS-9115-F) requiring health plans issuers individual group commercial markets disclose cost-sharing estimates additional content enrollees upon request, publicly post negotiated -network provider rates, historical --network allowed amounts billed charges, drug pricing information, including negotiated rates historical net prices. final rule latest number Administration efforts increase price transparency healthcare services order empower consumers make informed decisions foster price competition healthcare market. Beyond consumer empowerment, however, HHS clearly articulates principle focus counteracting price distortions driving prices commercial market. Therefore, just Hospital Price Transparency Final Rule, published November 2019 set take effect January 2021, faced strong stakeholder opposition subject legal challenge, final rule may likely challenged health plans industry stakeholders. Indeed, HHS clearly anticipates rule face legal challenges included severability clauses part rule even portion rule challenged successfully, provisions rule might continue survive.

title: Transparency in Coverage Guide
text: machine-readable file (MRF) defined digital representation data information file can imported read computer system processing without human intervention, ensuring semantic meaning lost. files CMS defined format (JSON) meant member-friendly search rates, benefits, cost sharing. table contents approved CMS schema approach combines -network rate files references locations (URLs) appropriate files can downloaded. Transparency Coverage Rule requires health insurers group health plans, including self-funded clients, provide cost-sharing data consumers via MRFs. must published publicly available site based enforcement date July 1, 2022 plan years beginning Jan. 1, 2022. files provide pricing data covered items services based -network negotiated payment rates historical --network allowed amounts. third machine-readable file prescription drug rates historical costs delayed pending guidance. Information files must updated published monthly. machine-readable files must available internet website free charge. user required establish user account, password, credentials require user submit personal identifying information name, email address, telephone number. Files required fewer 20 claims service provider.  · Files requirements regarding font size, accessibility, security settings. · Files may posted third party site. · Files may PDF Excel.

title: Transparency in Coverage Guide
text: JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) lightweight data-interchange format. easy humans read write. easy machines parse generate. based subset JavaScript Programming Language Standard ECMA-262 3rd Edition - December 1999. JSON text format completely language independent uses conventions familiar programmers C-family languages, including C, C++, C#, Java, JavaScript, Perl, Python, many others. properties make JSON ideal data-interchange language. JSON built two structures: collection name/value pairs. various languages, realized object, record, struct, dictionary, hash table, keyed list, associative array. ordered list values. languages, realized array, vector, list, sequence. universal data structures. Virtually modern programming languages support one form another. makes sense data format interchangeable programming languages also based structures.

title: Streamlined Workflow for Transparency in Coverage (TiC) Data Analysis
text: Transparency Coverage Final Rule[^2] requires group health plans issuers group individual health insurance disclose pricing information form machine-readable files containing following sets costs items services:  -Network Rate File: Rates covered items services plan issuer -network providers.  Allowed Amount File: Allowed amounts , billed charges , --network providers.

title: Streamlined Workflow for Transparency in Coverage (TiC) Data Analysis
code: res <- httr2::request("https://transparency-in-coverage.uhc.com/api/v1/uhc/blobs/") |>         httr2::req_perform() |>         httr2::resp_body_json(check_type = FALSE,                               simplifyVector = TRUE)  res$blobs |>    tibble::tibble() |>    dplyr::slice_tail() |>    dplyr::glimpse() #> Rows: 1 #> Columns: 2 #> $ name        <chr> "2023-01-01_totes-Isotoner_index.json" #> $ downloadUrl <chr> "https://uhc-tic-mrf.azureedge.net/public-mrf/2023-01-01/2… dl <- res$blobs |> tibble::tibble() |> dplyr::slice_tail()  dll <- httr2::request(dl$downloadUrl) |>         httr2::req_perform() |>         httr2::resp_body_json(check_type = FALSE, simplifyVector = TRUE)  dll$reporting_structure |>    tidyr::unnest(cols = c(reporting_plans, in_network_files)) |>    dplyr::glimpse() #> Rows: 2 #> Columns: 6 #> $ plan_name        <chr> "POS CHOICE PLUS", "POS CHOICE PLUS" #> $ plan_id          <chr> "310405270", "310405270" #> $ plan_id_type     <chr> "EIN", "EIN" #> $ plan_market_type <chr> "group", "group" #> $ description      <chr> "in-network files", "in-network files" #> $ location         <chr> "https://uhc-tic-mrf.azureedge.net/public-mrf/2023-01… dll$reporting_structure |>    tidyr::unnest(cols = c(reporting_plans, in_network_files)) |>    purrr::pluck("location", 1) #> [1] "https://uhc-tic-mrf.azureedge.net/public-mrf/2023-01-01/2023-01-01_United-HealthCare-Services--Inc-_Third-Party-Administrator_PPO---NDC_PPO-NDC_in-network-rates.json.gz" dll$reporting_structure |>    tidyr::unnest(cols = c(reporting_plans, in_network_files)) |>    purrr::pluck("location", 2) #> [1] "https://uhc-tic-mrf.azureedge.net/public-mrf/2023-01-01/2023-01-01_United-HealthCare-Services--Inc-_Third-Party-Administrator_PS1-50_C2_in-network-rates.json.gz" centene_toc_jun <- "https://www.centene.com/content/dam/centene/Centene%20Corporate/json/DOCUMENT/2022-06-29_ambetter_index.json" centene_toc_sep <- "https://www.centene.com/content/dam/centene/Centene%20Corporate/json/DOCUMENT/2022-09-30_ambetter_index.json" centene_toc_dec <- "https://www.centene.com/content/dam/centene/Centene%20Corporate/json/DOCUMENT/2022-12-29_ambetter_index.json" defog_toc(centene_toc_dec) |>    dplyr::select(!c(id,                     plan_id_type,                     plan_market_type,                     entity)) |>    dplyr::slice_head() |>    dplyr::glimpse() #> Rows: 1 #> Columns: 5 #> $ plan_name <chr> "Silver 87 Ambetter HMO " #> $ plan_id   <chr> "67138CA052" #> $ rate_type <chr> "in_network" #> $ location  <chr> "http://centene.com/content/dam/centene/Centene%20Corporate/… #> $ origin    <chr> "https://www.centene.com/content/dam/centene/Centene%20Corpo…

allowed_amount, billed_charge) |>    knitr::kable()
